titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Palestinian Student Films, 2012-2020 RL.11839

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-03-25 10:03:25 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Forty-three films by 44 Palestinian student filmmakers, created between 2012 and 2020, documenting or portraying the political context and lived experience in the West Bank and Gaza.
did.langmaterial: Materials in Arabic with English subtitles.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Films arranged alphabetically by first listed filmmaker.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: In 2017, 2018, and 2019, student filmmakers from Birzeit University, Al-Quds University, Al-Quds Bard University, Dar Al-Kalima University (Bethlehem), Hebron University, Palestine Polytechnic University (Hebron), An-Najah University (Nablus), Al-Azhar University (Gaza) and Al-Aqsa University (Gaza) submitted short student productions for inclusion in an annual film festival at Duke University, coordinated by Nancy Kalow, Lecturing Fellow at the Center for Documentary Studies. The festival continued in 2020, with themes including the COVID-19 pandemic.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Palestine Student Films were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2020.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Palestine Student Films, 2012-2019, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Craig Breaden, March 2020 and March 2021
Accessions described in this collection guide: 2020-0050, 2020-0093.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: 43 films by 44 Palestinian student filmmakers, created between 2012 and 2020, documenting or portraying the political context and lived experience in the West Bank and Gaza. The films were made in journalism, media, and film classes at nine Palestinian universities, and range from experimental and poetic, to documentary essay and ethnography, to scripted narrative fiction. The films are characterized by their high technical quality, their local feel and community-centered focus, and their varied expression of Palestinian identity. The filmmakers include Amjad Abu Baker, Noor AbuGhaniah, Mohammed Abd El Aziz Abu Hamam, Salah AbuNe'ma, Rayhan Abu Omar, Baha' Abu Shanab, Sarah AbuShusheh, Raja Ahmad, Alaa Alaloul, Mai Alami, Mohammad Alazza, Thaer Al Azzah, Lillian Al Azzeh, Ahmad Al-Bazz, Amjad M. A. Al Fayoumi, Sanabel Al-Hoot, Mohamed Nayef Ahmed Ali, Wisam Al-Jafari, Fatma Adel Qasem Alqadi, Maysa Al-Shaer, Anas Ashreef, Mahmoud Awad, Shayma' Awadeh, Alaa Dayeh, Omar Elemawi, Mohammed S. Ewais, Mohammad Houshieh, Yaser Jodallah, Abeer Kaabnah, Lara Khammash, Mohammed Khatib, Shatha Khatib, Aya Ahmed Matrabie, Renad Nasser, Ali Hamdan Okeh, Randa Owdeh, Lana Sadaqa, Yousef Salhi, Mohammed Shalodi, Naser Shatat, Khaled Tuaima, Salam Yahya, and Tala Zeitawi. Formats include MOV, MP4, and MPEG2 video files. Formats include MOV, MP4, and MPEG2 video files, and PNG, JPG, and PDF image files.

did.unittitle: Films shown at the 2017-2019 Duke University Festival of Student Films From Palestine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Single line descriptions and genre designations provided by the Duke Festival of Palestinian Student Films.

did.unittitle: Amjad Abu Baker [credited as Amjad Jamal] and Lillian Al Azzeh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fiction. Magical visions in a bleak prison (رُؤًى سحرية في سجن مظلم); Keywords: incarceration, dreams (أحلام، سَجن / احتجاز); Associated university/location: Al-Quds University Institute of Modern Media (جامعة القدس معهد الإعلام العصري‎), Ramallah.

scopecontent.p: Fiction. No way to get through (لا سبيل للعبور); Keywords: Gaza, checkpoints, political commentary (غزة، تعليق سياسي, نقاط التفتيش); Associated university/location: Birzeit University's program in Gaza (جامعة بيرزيت), Gaza.

did.unittitle: Rayhan Abu Omar, alternate spelling Rihana Abu Omar (ريحان ابو عمر)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documentary. A childhood in Hebron (طفولة في الخليل); Keywords: childhood, political commentary, disability (طفولة، إعاقة / عجز، تعليق سياسي); Associated university/location: Hebron University (جامعة الخليل), Hebron.

did.unittitle: The Living of the Pigeons (قوت الحمام)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documentary. A poetic observation of day laborers going through a checkpoint (رَصْد شعري لعمال مياومة يعبرون حاجزاً عسكرياً); Keywords: checkpoints, employment, political commentary (عمل، تعليق سياسي, نقاط التفتيش); Associated university/location: Dar Al-Kalima University College of Arts & Culture (دار الكلمة الجامعية), Bethlehem.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This item is only available in the reading room.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: Films shown at the 2020 Duke University Festival of Student Films From Palestine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Genre and single-line descriptions of the films were provided by the filmmakers. Series includes still images from films and of film makers, along with a program from the 2020 Duke Festival of Student Films from Palestine.

did.unittitle: Filmmaker photos and stills from films, and program from A Festival of Student Films from Palestine
